definition: to daydream/to indulge in wishful thinking

white/snowy/pure/bright/empty/blank/plain/clear/to make clear/in vain/gratuitous/free of charge/reactionary/anti-communist/funeral/to stare coldly/to write wrong character/to state/to explain/vernacular/spoken lines in opera
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan

to do/to make/to produce/to write/to compose/to act as/to engage in/to hold (a party)/to be/to become/to function (in some capacity)/to serve as/to be used for/to form (a bond or relationship)/to pretend/to feign/to act a part/to put on appearance
dream/CL:場|场[chang2],個|个[ge4]/(bound form) to dream

sentences.english: Recent research shows / indicates that daydreaming is part of daily life .
sentences.chinese: 最近的研究成果表明，白日做夢是日常生活的一部分。

sentences.english: Recent research indicates that ydreing is part of ily life.
sentences.chinese: 白日做夢是日常生活的一部分。

sentences.english: You’re dreaming if you think you can go to the United States.
sentences.chinese: 如果你以爲自己能去美國，那真是白日做夢。

sentences.english: His dreams about winning the mayor election are really out of sight.
sentences.chinese: 他要在市長選舉中獲勝簡直是白日做夢。

sentences.english: Ex:Her plans for a movie career were nothing but a pipe dream.
sentences.chinese: 她計劃進入影視圈簡直是在白日做夢。
